Title:
The Nickel-Plated-Feet Gang During the Occupation
(Les Pieds nickelés dans le maquis)
Notes: Banned in Yugoslavia by court order in 1945.

Title: About a Silence in Literature
Notes: Banned in Yugoslavia by court order in 1951.[citation needed]

Title: The New Class: An Analysis of the Communist System (1957)
Notes: Banned in Yugoslavia by court order in 1957; author sentenced for enemy propaganda to seven years in prison, prolonged to 13 years in 1962.

Title: Curved River
Notes: In 1963 in Yugoslavia withdrawn by the publisher (Nolit) at request of SDB officials.

Title: Dictionary of Modern Serbo-Croatian Language
Notes: Banned in Yugoslavia by court order in 1966, at request of Mirko Tepavac, because "some definitions can cause disturbance among citizens".

Title: A Message to Man and Humanity
Notes: Banned in Yugoslavia by court order in 1967 for "false and wicked claims, and enemy propaganda that supports pro-Chinese politics".

Title: On Fierce Wound – Fierce Herb
Notes: Withdrawn from sales and destroyed after the decision of the Municipal Committee of the League of Communists of Kraljevo in Kraljevo, Yugoslavia in 1967.

Title: Thoughts of a Corpse
Notes: Banned in Yugoslavia by court order in 1983; republished in 2004.

Title: Storytellers II
Notes: Withdrawn from print in Yugoslavia in 1964 because it contained stories by Dragiša Vasić.

Title: Castration of the Wind
Notes: Written in Tuzla prison in 1984. Banned in Yugoslavia by court order in 1984; republished in 2005.
